title: Government and the Economy - Personal Impact
description: Understanding when and why government intervenes in markets, how policies affect personal finances, and evaluating the costs and benefits of government economic activity including taxes, regulations, and public services.
learning_objectives: Identify market failures that justify government intervention
Explain the economic roles of government: property rights, public goods, regulation, and redistribution
Analyze how taxes, subsidies, and regulations affect market outcomes
Evaluate trade-offs between government intervention and market freedom
Apply cost-benefit analysis to evaluate government policies

skill_builder.title: Policy Impact Analyzer
skill_builder.description: An interactive tool where students analyze how government policies affect personal finances, apply cost-benefit analysis to evaluate regulations and subsidies, assess specific state and federal policies, and develop informed opinions on government's appropriate economic role.
